title: Puro-Puro

properties.name: description
properties.value: Puro-Puro is the magical homeworld for imp-like creatures, like implings who are infamous for stealing various items from the citizens of Gielinor before fleeing to Puro-Puro; however, not all implings manage to find their way back and may remain trapped on Gielinor. In recent times, the portals have remained open for long enough to allow adventurers to find their way to Puro-Puro.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Puro-Puro
Puro-Puro
Released11 June 2007 (Update)
MembersYes
LocationNone
TeleportsCrop circle in Zanaris
Map

Puro-Puro is the magical homeworld for imp-like creatures, like implings who are infamous for stealing various items from the citizens of Gielinor before fleeing to Puro-Puro; however, not all implings manage to find their way back and may remain trapped on Gielinor. In recent times, the portals have remained open for long enough to allow adventurers to find their way to Puro-Puro.

Puro-Puro contains 11 of the 12 types of implings that can be caught by players using the Hunter skill, as crystal implings may only be caught within the walls of Prifddinas.

Completion of the Lost City quest is not required to gain entry if a player uses one of the crop circles located around the world. Using these crop circles gives 'Farmer's Affinity', and when travelling to Puro-Puro through these overworld crop fields players receive a 30-minute buff allowing them to push through the wheat faster. Talking to the Wandering impling in Zanaris will reveal where the crop circle is currently located in the overworld.

Contents

  • 1 Transportation
  • 2 Locations
    • 2.1 The Maze
  • 3 Personalities and implings
  • 4 Music
  • 5 Changes

Transportation[edit | edit source]

When an imp appears in various wheat fields around Gielinor and begins walking in circles, a temporary crop circle will form which will allow players to teleport to Puro-Puro. Players must have at least level 17 Hunter in order to step through these crop circles. For those who have completed the Lost City quest, a permanent crop circle can be found in the wheat field east of the fairy ring in Zanaris. All other crop circles, which are temporary and can last around 30 minutes, have a chance to spawn in any of the following locations:

  • Ardougne - Wheat patch north of the Ardougne Market.
  • Brimhaven - Wheat patch north of the Brimhaven Agility Arena.
  • Catherby - Wheat patch north-east of the Catherby allotment patch.
  • Draynor Village - Wheat patch north-east of the Draynor Village bank.
  • Farming Guild - Wheat patch south-east of the Farming Guild.
  • Gwenith - Wheat patch south of the Gwenith windmill.
  • Harmony Island - Wheat patch north of the chapel.
  • Hosidius - Wheat patch north of the Hosidius POH portal.
  • Lumbridge - Wheat patch north-west of Lumbridge, south-west of the Mill Lane Mill.
  • Miscellania - Wheat patch south-east of the Miscellania Castle.
  • Mos Le'Harmless - Wheat patch east of Dodgy Mike's Second Hand Clothing.
  • Rimmington - Wheat patch south of the Rimmington mine.
  • Taverley - Wheat patch south of Doric's hut.
  • Taverley - Wheat patch north-east of the Taverley Dungeon entrance.
  • Tree Gnome Stronghold - Wheat patch south-west of the Grand Tree.
  • Varrock - Wheat patch north of the Cooks' Guild.
  • Varrock - Wheat patch south-east of the Champions' Guild.
  • Yanille - Wheat patch north-west of the Wizards' Guild.

Locations[edit | edit source]

The Maze[edit | edit source]

A schematic map of the wheat that can wither away (marked red), with the portal marked in blue in the middle.

Currently, the Maze is the only accessible feature of Puro-Puro, and contains a number of implings of varying types. As mentioned above, all the player needs to do is enter a portal, and they will find themselves just outside the Maze. Elnock Inquisitor is also located outside the Maze, and will give the player advice and instructions for the Impetuous Impulses minigame. Due to the magical nature of Puro-Puro, the maze is constantly changing, with new walls and passages appearing every few minutes, and the player's mini-map will also malfunction when on this world.

Personalities and implings[edit | edit source]

  • Elnock Inquisitor
  • Baby impling (17 Hunter)
  • Young impling (22 Hunter)
  • Gourmet impling (28 Hunter)
  • Earth impling (36 Hunter)
  • Essence impling (42 Hunter)
  • Eclectic impling (50 Hunter)
  • The Implings listed below are rarer than the ones listed above. They share the same spawn, which is in the north-west and south-east corners. A good strategy is to catch the Nature or Magpie so that there is a chance that the even rarer ones will spawn instead.
  • Nature impling (58 Hunter)
  • Magpie impling (65 Hunter)
  • Ninja impling (74 Hunter)
  • Dragon impling (83 Hunter)
  • Lucky impling (89 Hunter)

Music[edit | edit source]

  • Impetuous

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
8 October 2015
(update)

Ironmen can no longer catch an Impling in Puro Puro that another player has had released by an Imp Defender.

'''Puro-Puro''' is the magical homeworld for [[imp]]-like creatures, like [[impling]]s who are infamous for stealing various items from the citizens of [[Gielinor]] before fleeing to Puro-Puro; however, not all implings manage to find their way back and may remain trapped on Gielinor. In recent times, the portals have remained open for long enough to allow adventurers to find their way to Puro-Puro.

Puro-Puro contains 11 of the 12 types of implings that can be caught by players using the [[Hunter]] skill, as [[crystal impling]]s may only be caught within the walls of [[Prifddinas]].

Completion of the [[Lost City]] quest is not required to gain entry if a player uses one of the [[crop circle]]s located around the world. Using these crop circles gives 'Farmer's Affinity', and when travelling to Puro-Puro through these overworld crop fields players receive a 30-minute buff allowing them to push through the wheat faster. Talking to the [[Wandering impling]] in [[Zanaris]] will reveal where the crop circle is currently located in the overworld.

==Transportation==
When an imp appears in various wheat fields around Gielinor and begins walking in circles, a temporary [[crop circle]] will form which will allow players to teleport to Puro-Puro. Players must have at least level 17 Hunter in order to step through these crop circles. For those who have completed the [[Lost City]] quest, a permanent crop circle can be found in the wheat field east of the [[fairy ring]] in [[Zanaris]]. All other crop circles, which are temporary and can last around 30 minutes, have a chance to spawn in any of the following locations:

* [[Ardougne]] - Wheat patch north of the [[Ardougne Market]].
* [[Brimhaven]] - Wheat patch north of the [[Brimhaven Agility Arena]].
* [[Catherby]] - Wheat patch north-east of the [[Catherby]] allotment patch.
* [[Draynor Village]] - Wheat patch north-east of the [[Draynor Village]] bank.
* [[Farming Guild]] - Wheat patch south-east of the [[Farming Guild]].

* [[Harmony Island]] - Wheat patch north of the chapel.
* [[Hosidius]] - Wheat patch north of the [[Hosidius]] [[POH portal]].
* [[Lumbridge]] - Wheat patch north-west of [[Lumbridge]], south-west of the [[Mill Lane Mill]].
* [[Miscellania]] - Wheat patch south-east of the [[Miscellania Castle]].
* [[Mos Le'Harmless]] - Wheat patch east of [[Dodgy Mike's Second Hand Clothing.|Dodgy Mike's Second Hand Clothing]].
* [[Rimmington]] - Wheat patch south of the [[Rimmington mine]].
* [[Taverley]] - Wheat patch south of [[Doric's hut]].

==Locations==
===The Maze===
[[File:Puro-Puro Map.png|thumb|A schematic map of the wheat that can wither away (marked red), with the portal marked in blue in the middle.]]
Currently, the Maze is the only accessible feature of Puro-Puro, and contains a number of [[impling]]s of varying types. As mentioned above, all the player needs to do is enter a portal, and they will find themselves just outside the Maze. [[Elnock Inquisitor]] is also located outside the Maze, and will give the player advice and instructions for the [[Impetuous Impulses]] minigame. Due to the magical nature of Puro-Puro, the maze is constantly changing, with new walls and passages appearing every few minutes, and the player's [[mini-map]] will also malfunction when on this world.
